user:
Given a list of Javadoc tags (starting with @param, @return, or @throws), you need to create up to five semantically-equivalent variants for each of them, by performing the following changes:
1) Replace words with synonyms.
2) Change the order of the sentence.
3) Paraphrase.
4) Shorten.
5) Extend.
However, you have to leave the `@param`, `@throws`, and `@return` unchanged.

In what follows, I'll provide an example input with this structure:

input = [
    '@return weighted length of shortest path known, or
Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no path found yet',
    '@throws UnsupportedOperationException if the underlying iterator is not of
type {@link ListIterator}'
]

In the next messages I will provide the input to process.

. The first term after `@param` and `@throws` must be unchanged because it refers to the name of the variable or the exception. Did you understand the task?
assistant:
Yes, I understood the task. You want me to take a list of Javadoc tags starting with "@param," "@return," or "@throws" and generate up to five semantically-equivalent variants for each tag. The variants should be created by replacing words with synonyms, changing the sentence order, paraphrasing, shortening, or extending the original tag. I will produce the outuput as a list of objects containing two attributes: the attribute `tag` contains the string representing the original javadoc tag, while the attribute `alternatives` contains the list of the five different alternatives that you produce from the original javadoc tag.

 If the original javadoc tags starts with '@param' also all the corresponding alternatives will start with '@param', if the original javadoc tags starts with '@return' also all the corresponding alternatives will start with '@return', and if the original javadoc tags starts with '@throws' also all the corresponding alternatives will start with '@throws'. Moreover, the first term after `@param` and `@throws` must be unchanged because it refers to the name of the variable or the exception. I will return only the list, without any other comment or word.

 To give you an example, given the input you provided before: 
input = [
    '@return weighted length of shortest path known, or
Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no path found yet',
    '@throws UnsupportedOperationException if the underlying iterator is not of
type {@link ListIterator}'
]

 I will produce the following output: 

output = [
  {
    'tag': '@return weighted length of shortest path known, or
Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no path found yet',
    'alternatives': [
      '@return weighted distance of the most short route known,
otherwiseDouble.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no route discovered until now',
      '@return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no path found yet, or
weighted length of shortest path known.',
      '@return either return the weighted length of the shortest path known,
or return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no path was found yet',
      '@return weighted length shortest path known or
Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no path found',
      '@return the weighted length of the shortest path that is known. Otherwise
return Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY if no path has been found yet.'
    ]
  },
  {
    'tag': '@throws UnsupportedOperationException if the underlying iterator is not of
type {@link ListIterator}',
    'alternatives': [
      '@throws UnsupportedOperationException if the iterator underlying the operation
is not of type {@link ListIterator}.',
      '@throws UnsupportedOperationException if the underlying iterator does not
belong to the {@link ListIterator} type.',
      '@throws UnsupportedOperationException when the underlying iterator is not
an instance of {@link ListIterator}.',
      '@throws UnsupportedOperationException if the type of the underlying iterator
differs from {@link ListIterator}.',
      '@throws UnsupportedOperationException if the iterator underlying the operation
is not a {@link ListIterator}.'
    ]
  }
]
